analysis.narrative:

key_themes: Policy-driven capital spending and deregulation tailwinds
Monetary easing and credit availability supporting rate-sensitive sectors
Year-end forced liquidations and holiday illiquidity creating tactical weakness
Rotation within strength: AI infrastructure beneficiaries vs. traditional software headwinds
Regulatory clarity removal creating multi-quarter upside optionality
risk_factors: Geopolitical escalation (Russia-Ukraine, Taiwan tensions) triggering risk-off rotation
Earnings quality deterioration in enterprise software and fintech sectors signaling demand weakness
Cascade liquidations if crypto or commodity liquidation pressure expands systemically
Fed policy disappointment or recession cycle catalyst negating capex stimulus assumptions
Cross-asset deleveraging extending into early January on thin post-holiday volumes
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 call wall for resistance (active hedging); support at $670 (active level). QQQ: Tight range between $625 and $630; both levels show active hedging. Low holiday volume suggests choppy, range-bound action with exaggerated moves on thin order flow.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Target $700 call wall as near-term resistance; if broken, $730 (dormant resistance, 5.7% away) becomes active. Support anchor at $670 (active). Broader swing target: $750 (dormant call wall, 8.6% away) if structural themes dominate post-holidays. QQQ: $630 call wall is primary near-term resistance; $640 becomes active if broken. Put support floor at $590 (dormant, 5.4% away) acts as swing-trading target if selloff accelerates.

regime.label: NEUTRAL
regime.summary: Market is lacking clear direction. Wait for confirmation.

action.summary: NEUTRAL: No clear edge. Cash is a position.
